 i agree and i stand similarly with you, but a few things, you can believe in a scientific theory; there are true scientific theories and there are disproven scientific theories, and there are also scientific theories in the works. evolution and age of the earth are proven, true scientific theories which in that case youre right, you cant 'believe' in them because they are true whether you acknowledge them or not, and that would also imply that there are people who do not believe in them which may seem plausable but those who claim to hold a disbelief in evolution simply are not educated in the theory. for example, the interesting and currently in the works 'growing earth theory'. you can either believe it or not. also, when you say you accept evolution, that equally implies that you can not accept evolution, which seems to me like a belief one way or another.

my stand point is to argue that evolution is true and has been confirmed numerous times.

 You are correct. But not only has it been confirmed, it has never been found to be incorrect. In cases where some theories of evolution have been disproved by later research, that research actually confirmed evolution while disproving an incorrect theory of how it happens. An example that comes to mind is the "hopeful monster" theory (saltation) of Goldschmidt. The funny thing is that a single mutation was observed in an arthropod that suppressed all abdominal appendages, leaving only six thoracic appendages. Funny that. A hopeful monster that was unanticipated. But only a rare example, since most evolution doesn't happen that way.
